notes: Fire degrees extracted by analyzing distillation instructions, material type, and method keywords in the German source text

recipes.reasoning: Red cabbage (Rot kol) - standard herb, leaves chopped and distilled end of May, no special fire instructions
Rue (Ruten) - standard herb, leaves stripped from stems and distilled mid-May, no balneum mariae mentioned
Earthworm (Regen wurm) - animal material requires gentle processing, distilled after cleaning through moss
Larkspur (Ritter sporn) - herb, stem and flowers chopped and distilled beginning of June, standard distillation
Corn cockle (Ratten krut) - herb with all substance distilled end of May, standard method
Rose water general (Rosen) - flowers, petals broken off when fully ripe, delicate flower material
Red rose (Rot rosen) - cultivated rose flowers, delicate material requiring gentle heat
White rose (Wyss rosen) - explicitly states 'gediſtilliert werdẽ in balneũ marie' (balneum mariae)
Dog rose/hip rose (Butten rosen) - wild rose flowers, delicate material
Rose bud (Rosen knopff) - young rose buds, very delicate material
Peony rose (Beonien rosen) - flowers mixed with root (twice weight), combined flower-root requiring moderate heat
Turnip (Ruben) - root vegetable, standard distillation, no specific fire instructions in truncated entry
St. John's wort (Sant Johanns krut) - leaves and flowers stripped from stems, distilled end of June
Star jelly (Stern geschutz) - fungal/gelatinous substance found on wood, delicate material distilled end of May
Male orchid root (Stendel wurtz menlin) - root only distilled end of May, harder root material
Female orchid root (Stendel wurtz wyblin) - root only, same method as male, harder root material
Melilot/sweet clover (Steyn kle) - leaves and flowers stripped from stems, distilled end of June
Royal fern (Sant Cristofferus krut) - fern type, chopped and distilled end of May, standard method
Water lily (Seblumen) - white aquatic flowers distilled when fully ripe, delicate flower material
Saxifrage (Steinbrech) - small green herb distilled beginning of June, or with seed mid-May
Scabious (Scabiosen) - herb with small leaves chopped and distilled end of May
Sage (Salbeien) - herb distilled when flowering, standard method with broad-leaved variety
Sanicle (Sanickel) - herb and root chopped and distilled mid-May
Earth snail/slug (Erd schnecken) - animal material, red slugs found when raining, distilled end of May or autumn, gentle processing
Ribwort plantain (Spitz wegrich) - root and herb chopped and distilled mid-May
Lady's mantle (Synnow) - root and herb chopped and distilled end of May
Pointed burdock (Spitz kletten) - fruit with root chopped and distilled when ripe, tougher material
Southernwood (Schoss wurtz) - leaves stripped from stems, distilled beginning of June
Greater celandine (Schelwurtz) - herb and root chopped and distilled mid-May
Unripe sloe (Vnzitige schlehen) - unripe fruit crushed and distilled end of September
Sloe blossom (Schlehen bluet) - flowers, delicate material (short entry)
Barberry (Surouch) - ripe berries/fruit distilled in autumn
Spikenard (Spicanardi) - exotic import, prepared per instructions in chapter 20, dried material requires standard heat
Savin (Seuen boum) - shrub growth stripped from stem, distilled first autumn month
Mustard herb (Senff krut) - herb distilled when flowering, beginning of June
Pellitory-of-the-wall (Sant Peters krut) - leaves and stems chopped and distilled end of May
Asparagus (Spargen) - root, stem, and herb chopped and distilled in May or autumn
Spindle tree (Spindel boum) - leaves and fruit distilled when fruit is ripe and red
Caper spurge (Sprinck krut) - stems and leaves distilled at beginning of full growth
Oregano (Tosten) - herb and stem chopped when flowering, end of June
Tormentil (Tormentillen) - bloodroot with red root, root material requires stronger heat
Dodder (Tottern) - parasitic plant from flax fields, standard distillation
Grape marc (Binen trostern) - wine lees distilled in autumn
Tamarisk (Tamarisken) - bark shaved and leaves stripped, chopped and distilled mid-May
Wormwood (Wermut) - leaves and tops stripped from stems, distilled end of May
Comfrey (Walwurtz) - root only, washed, scraped, and distilled mid-May, root material requires stronger heat
Willow leaf (Wilgen loub) - leaves stripped from white willows, distilled mid-May from first-year shoots
Willow blossom (Wilgen bluet) - flowers, delicate material like other blossom waters
Hemlock (Wuntscherling) - herb from stem distilled mid-May, poisonous cold herb
Bindweed (Winden krut) - herb with white bells from fences, distilled mid-May
Chicory (Wegwyss) - herb and root chopped and distilled mid-May
Chicory flower (Wegwyss blumen) - blue flowers distilled as soon as opened, delicate flower material
Mullein (Wullen krut) - herb distilled when fully ripe, standard method
Knotgrass (Weggras) - herb and root chopped and distilled mid-May
Solomon's seal (Wyss wurtz) - root only chopped and distilled end of May, root material
Wild sage (Wild salbei) - leaves and stems chopped and distilled mid-May
Wintergreen (Winter gruen) - herb, stem, and root from male variety distilled mid-May
White pea (Wyss erbeiss) - green pods/shells crushed and distilled
Wild pear (Wild bieren) - fruit crushed before softening, beginning of autumn
Clary sage (Scharlach) - tame variety distilled mid-May, standard herb
Spurge/wolf's milk (Wolffs milch) - large variety with herb, stem, and root at beginning of flowering
White lily flower (Wyss gylgen) - white flower petals only, broken off when fully ripe, end of June, delicate
White lily root (Wyss gylgen wurtzel) - bulb/root only, requires stronger heat than flowers
White lily combined (Wyss gylgen mit iren wurtzeln) - flowers and roots together chopped, intermediate difficulty
Maidenhair fern (Wider tod krut) - whole substance distilled mid-May
Juniper berry (Weckolter beer) - black ripe berries crushed and distilled beginning of autumn, harder berry material
Woodruff (Walt meister) - herb, stem, root with all substance, wild variety from woods, end of May
Safflower/wild saffron (Wild saffron) - leaves broken from stem, distilled end of May
Christmas rose root (Xpi wurtz wurtzel) - root only chopped and distilled end of August, niess-wurtz root
Christmas rose herb (Xpi wurtz krut) - herb only chopped and distilled mid-May
Sweet flag root (Xpian wurtzelen) - root only crushed and distilled between two Lady Days, sweet root material
Bittersweet (Ye lenger ye lieber) - middle bark scraped off shoots end of June, distilled end of May
Onion (Zybel) - common onion root chopped and distilled first autumn month
Daisy (Zytlosen krut) - herb and root chopped and distilled mid-May
Bryony root (Zytwan wurtzel) - wild bryony root chopped and distilled end of May, tough root material
